alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Butler; Carter (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 4:36PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Missouri, including the following counties, Bollinger, Butler, Carter, Ripley and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 436 PM CST, Minor flooding was reported on Highway K in Ellsinore. Additional areas of minor flooding are possible in the area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. A flash flood watch remains in effect for the area through tonight. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poplar Bluff, Doniphan, Piedmont, Van Buren, Lake Wappapello State Park, Greenville, Sam A. Baker State Park, Naylor, Neelyville, Qulin, Ellsinore, Williamsville, Fisk, Brush Arbor, Milltown, Budapest, Hendrickson, Fairdealing, Hunter and Harviell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
